commit_message:
Use constraints on all targets.

The neutron-vpnaas repo already has converted to using constraints for
targets. However, the TC recommendation is to use constraints on the
original job names (pep8, py27,...), instead of using the constrained
names (e.g. pep8-constraints).

A separate commit (I34f0b355703fe0133f160afd4e32f2272d41ecaa) restored
the use of the non-constraint NAMED jobs for Liberty and newer.

This commit modifies those non-constraints targets so that they use
constraints. A manual check was made that each target used the same
package versions for both constraints and non-constraints targets.

Then, after both constraints and non-constraints jobs passed in Jenkins
(before and after the project-config commit was upstreamed), the constraints
based targets were removed from tox.ini.

Note: Found out that infra doesn't support constraints based cover and
releasenotes. Added TODO to these targets so that they can be updated,
if and when constraints are supported.

Note: In the gate hook, config_for_vpn_func_testing.sh calls Neutron's
config_for_func_testing.sh, which will setup files in the venv. To prevent
that script from modifying the VENV variable to have -constraints suffix
and store files in the wrong venv, we turn off USE_CONSTRAINT_ENV, prior
to calling the Neutron script.

Once this is upstreamed, we can backport this fix to Liberty to complete
the effort for this repo.

Change-Id: I4a2410ab80e6018f1b65b2288ae66312eb49cb27
Depends-On: I34f0b355703fe0133f160afd4e32f2272d41ecaa
Partial-Bug: #1522503

commit_message:
Add sanity tests for testing actions with Chassis

Smoke tests for the Ironic CLI commands
which checks basic actions with chassis command like
create, update, delete etc.

Change-Id: Ib9d34aca954d25b6074ca785d5c3ac1e06c4297a
Closes-Bug: #1527515
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-ironicclient refs/changes/62/240562/17 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _try_delete_chassis(self, chassis_id): chassis_list = self.list_chassis() if self.get_object(chassis_list, chassis_id): self.ironic('chassis-delete', params=chassis_id) chassis_list = self.list_chassis() chassis_list_uuid = map(lambda item: item['UUID'], chassis_list) if chassis_list in chassis_list_uuid: self.fail('Ironic chassis {0} has not been deleted!' .format(chassis_id)) def create_chassis(self, params=''): chassis = self.ironic('chassis-create', params=params) chassis = self.get_dict_from_output(chassis) if not chassis.get('uuid'): self.fail('Ironic chassis has not been created!') self.addCleanup(self._try_delete_chassis, chassis['uuid']) return chassis def list_chassis(self, params=''): return self.ironic('chassis-list', params=params) def show_chassis(self, params): chassis_show = self.ironic('chassis-show', params=params) return self.get_dict_from_output(chassis_show)

commit_message:
Add copying new api-paste.ini for new /v3 endpoint

Cinder is adding a new /v3 endpoint for api-microversion. This
requires a change to api-paste.ini, and so the file must be
copied to the proper directory.

Change-Id: I17eb25cd73c99dcac85af5f47c651da2697463a1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/grenade refs/changes/05/276505/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # ensure we have new paste.ini file for addition of new /v3 endpoint sudo cp $TARGET_RELEASE_DIR/cinder/etc/cinder/api-paste.ini $CINDER_CONF_DIR

subject: Catch OSError as well to return a better error message
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-22 07:11:11.000000000', 'files': ['ironic_python_agent/extensions/iscsi.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic-python-agent/commit/c716293cbfeaae56de714aa0294a9c614578a805', 'message': "Catch OSError as well to return a better error message

When neither tgt nor linux-io are available, we only get error
message like 'No such file or directory', this situation should
be detected and return a better error instead.

commit_message:
Catch OSError as well to return a better error message

When neither tgt nor linux-io are available, we only get error
message like 'No such file or directory', this situation should
be detected and return a better error instead.

Change-Id: I334717a1a8a728aa6da6024ff9fc6d817399a41f
Closes-Bug: #1540958

commit_message:
Cleanup after enable files refactor

Reecently, while the "enabled" files were refactored from a
2 digit to 4 digit numbering scheme, we had to introduce
some logic to handle both the old and new numbering to
ensure the change made it through the gates.

Now that that change has successfully been committed,
this change cleans up that excess logic.

Change-Id: Ie7769a52f944fdceabdf9cec64c678425d341129

"""Database migrations for resource-providers.""" from sqlalchemy import Column from sqlalchemy import MetaData from sqlalchemy import String from sqlalchemy import Table def upgrade(migrate_engine): meta = MetaData() meta.bind = migrate_engine for table_name in ('', 'shadow_'): uuid_column = Column('uuid', String(36)) aggregates = Table('%saggregates' % table_name, meta) aggregates.create_column(uuid_column)

commit_message:
Skip extend_start.sh if KOLLA_SKIP_EXTEND_START is defined

This is all kolla-mesos needs, so that we can run the extend_start
within the context of our start script. We need to do this to track
dependencies of the commands (one of which is the extend_start).

implements blueprint custom-extend-start

Change-Id: Ib844adc9c42dd8862281eb3f903d6c2b4695a34d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/39/283339/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if [[ ! "${!KOLLA_SKIP_EXTEND_START[@]}" ]]; then # Run additional commands if present source kolla_extend_start fi
deleted_lines: # Run additional commands if present source kolla_extend_start

ssl-enabled when we are running that way.

the job's status in the API is not null

subject: Unscoped PKI token should no longer be hashed multiple times.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-07 12:54:44.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_auth/user.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/django_openstack_auth/commit/5ab3908cff64fa5b5a5bd5ea4877c42096172dd3', 'message': 'Unscoped PKI token should no longer be hashed multiple times.

When token hashing is used with pki tokens, the unscoped token
gets re-hashed when switching project. This fix checks
if the unscoped token needs to be hashed before doing so.

The project list operation when switching project in horizon
failed because the unscoped token could for example be an

Closes-Bug: #1487372
'}]
commit_message:
Unscoped PKI token should no longer be hashed multiple times.

When token hashing is used with pki tokens, the unscoped token
gets re-hashed when switching project. This fix checks
if the unscoped token needs to be hashed before doing so.

The project list operation when switching project in horizon
failed because the unscoped token could for example be an
md5 of an md5.

Change-Id: I64684ca251eb4d0c6164e58c078cf7d132eb3cc1
Closes-Bug: #1487372
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/django_openstack_auth refs/changes/55/264755/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if _TOKEN_HASH_ENABLED and self._is_pki_token(self.id): # Only hash unscoped token if needed if self._is_pki_token(self.unscoped_token): hasher = hashlib.new(algorithm) hasher.update(self.unscoped_token) self.unscoped_token = hasher.hexdigest() def _is_pki_token(self, token): """Determines if this is a pki-based token (pki or pkiz)""" return (keystone_cms.is_ans1_token(token) or keystone_cms.is_pkiz(token))
deleted_lines: if (_TOKEN_HASH_ENABLED and (keystone_cms.is_asn1_token(self.id) or keystone_cms.is_pkiz(self.id))): # If the scoped_token is long, then unscoped_token must be too. hasher = hashlib.new(algorithm) hasher.update(self.unscoped_token) self.unscoped_token = hasher.hexdigest()

commit_message:
Add UEFI support for iPXE

This patch adds UEFI support for iPXE, the changes made are:

* Remove conditional preventing iPXE to be configured with UEFI

* Add the boot_mode= kernel parameter to the iPXE template

* Add initrd=deploy_ramdisk kernel parameter to the iPXE template. The
  UEFI support in iPXE requires the kernel argument to match what the
  initrd expects. For more information see [0]

[0] http://forum.ipxe.org/showthread.php?tid=7589&pid=11843#pid11843

Conflicts:
	doc/source/deploy/install-guide.rst
	ironic/tests/common/test_pxe_utils.py

Closes-Bug: #1525989
Change-Id: I6e74bc6332c5aba92ef0de8694fd4259c596cf03
(cherry picked from commit 2a5005d946de35625adc910dff912404aa0ade70)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/64/281564/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - Adds support for using iPXE in UEFI mode.

commit_message:
Fix issues with uefi-ipxe booting

When booting from ipxe in uefi boot mode, once the node boots with deploy
image, ironic is not changing the default menu entry to boot_partition
to boot the instance image during next boot. The current changes fix
the issue. The kernel parameter "initrd=ramdisk" is also added to the ipxe
template which is required for ipxe booting.

Closes-Bug: #1532679
Change-Id: Idf78195d228b4861f85fbcae9a269edd95523ad7
(cherry picked from commit 91906c5928be8bf0621ffb18baaea8c8b2607645)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/36/281536/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: kernel {{ pxe_options.aki_path }} root={{ ROOT }} ro text {{ pxe_options.pxe_append_params|default("", true) }} initrd=ramdisk
deleted_lines: kernel {{ pxe_options.aki_path }} root={{ ROOT }} ro text {{ pxe_options.pxe_append_params|default("", true) }}

commit_message:
Remove MySQL-python from Aodh pip requirements

Aodh does not connect to MySQL and therefore does not need the MySQL-python
wheel installed.

Change-Id: Ic20270bcdf259daa5d5a0da3a55cb2a72fd90677

commit_message:
implements: blueprint synchronizer-nagios-get-all

load nagios configuration file

Change-Id: If611d120dfd49e256e48f26d1dc95fe0ed95c0e1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/vitrage refs/changes/32/283132/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2016 - Nokia # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from oslo_config import cfg from oslo_log import log as logging from vitrage.synchronizer.plugins.nagios.config import NagiosConfig from vitrage.synchronizer.plugins.nagios.config import NagiosRule from vitrage.tests import base from vitrage.tests.mocks import utils LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) class TestNagiosConfig(base.BaseTest): OPTS = [ cfg.StrOpt('nagios_config_file', default=utils.get_resources_dir() + '/nagios/nagios_conf.yaml', help='Nagios configuation file' ), ] # the rules match the ones in nagios_conf.yaml RULE_1 = NagiosRule('compute-1', 'service1', 'host', 'compute-1') RULE_2 = NagiosRule('compute-1', 'service1', 'host', 'compute-2') RULE_3 = NagiosRule('compute-1', 'service2', 'instance', 'instance-2') RULE_4 = NagiosRule('(.*)', '(.*)', 'host', '${host.name}') RULE_5 = NagiosRule('instance-(.*)', '(.*)', 'instance', '${host.name}') RULE_6 = NagiosRule('compute-(.*)', 'service1', 'host', '${host.name}') RULE_7 = \ NagiosRule('compute-(.*)', 'service2|service3', 'host', '${host.name}') RULE_8 = \ NagiosRule('compute-(.*)', 'a-service-(.*)', 'host', '${host.name}') RULES = [RULE_1, RULE_2, RULE_3, RULE_4, RULE_5, RULE_6, RULE_7, RULE_8] NON_EXISTING_RULE_1 = NagiosRule('X', 'service1', 'host', 'compute-1') NON_EXISTING_RULE_2 = NagiosRule('compute-1', 'X', 'host', 'compute-1') NON_EXISTING_RULE_3 = NagiosRule('compute-1', 'service1', 'X', 'compute-1') NON_EXISTING_RULE_4 = NagiosRule('compute-1', 'service1', 'host', 'X') NON_EXISTING_RULES = [NON_EXISTING_RULE_1, NON_EXISTING_RULE_2, NON_EXISTING_RULE_3, NON_EXISTING_RULE_4] def setUp(self): super(TestNagiosConfig, self).setUp() self.conf = cfg.ConfigOpts() self.conf.register_opts(self.OPTS, group='synchronizer_plugins') def test_nagios_configuration_loading(self): # Action nagios_conf = NagiosConfig(self.conf) # Test assertions rules = nagios_conf.rules self.assertIsNotNone(nagios_conf, "no nagios configuration loaded") self.assertEqual(len(self.RULES), len(rules)) self.assertTrue(rule in rules for rule in self.RULES) for rule in self.NON_EXISTING_RULES: self.assertFalse(rule in rules)

commit_message:
Increase undercloud swap to 2 GB

We're still seeing some OOM errors in the HA job.  We do need to
determine what our acceptable memory size is, but it appears even
6 GB (5 GB + 1 GB swap) is currently not enough for HA deploys.
This change increases the swap to 2 GB so the HA job won't get
killed by these OOMs.

The host_info.txt from the failed run had the following free stats:

              total        used        free
Mem:           4.8G        4.4G        198M
Swap:          1.0G        1.0G        2.3M

So you can see we were right up against the limit.

Change-Id: I2bcdabbba6a123eccdaee56fa4c8bcc6c74616c7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci refs/changes/62/282462/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: dd if=/dev/zero of=/swapfile count=2k bs=1M

'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2016-02-22 17:42:19.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt', 'upper-constraints.txt'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/requirements/commit/a45c70016262cbfc858b82e843f92e4ec3599de8', 'message': "Adds PyMI as a global-requirement

PyMI is a drop-in replacement for the old, unmaintained WMI module.
The new module maintains the same interface, while providing better
error handling, better multithreading support, better performance
and a higher reliability.

Maintenance. PyMI is developed by Cloudbase Solutions, active
contributors to the OpenStack project. Any bug found has been dealt
with as soon as possible. Also, it does not depend on the pywin32
library. Recent history can be observed at [1]. Meanwhile, the latest
WMI release was on 2011.04.13. [2]

Code quality. The code has been tested repeatedly on the Hyper-V CI and
using rally. Any and all found issues that occured during testing has
been solved. The performance gain was noticeable. Succesful Hyper-V CI
runs using PyMI can be observed at [3][4][5][6].

Python 3. PyMI is python 3 compatible, the python 3.4 wheel is available
on pypi [7].

License. The library is Apache 2.0 licensed [8].

Packaging. Wheels for python 2.7 and 3.4 can be found on pypi. This
library is meant for Windows operating systems.

Other libraries. As mentioned before, WMI has the same functionality as
PyMI. Compared to PyMI, WMI it is unmaintained and outdated, we've hit
plenty of issues and bugs using it, it is slow, it does not have any
multithreading support, and it also depends on pywin32.

Replacing WMI with PyMI can lead to an enhanced experience overall.

[1] https://github.com/cloudbase/PyMI/commits/master
[2] https://pypi.python.org/pypi/WMI/
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/256611/
[4] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/256616/
[5] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/256614/
[6] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/256585/
[7] https://pypi.python.org/pypi/PyMI/1.0.0
[8] https://github.com/cloudbase/PyMI/blob/master/LICENSE

Change-Id: Ia2d059ed4550f0aaaea5d8da10a254ca67674eec
"}]
commit_message:
Adds PyMI as a global-requirement

PyMI is a drop-in replacement for the old, unmaintained WMI module.
The new module maintains the same interface, while providing better
error handling, better multithreading support, better performance
and a higher reliability.

Maintenance. PyMI is developed by Cloudbase Solutions, active
contributors to the OpenStack project. Any bug found has been dealt
with as soon as possible. Also, it does not depend on the pywin32
library. Recent history can be observed at [1]. Meanwhile, the latest
WMI release was on 2011.04.13. [2]

Code quality. The code has been tested repeatedly on the Hyper-V CI and
using rally. Any and all found issues that occured during testing has
been solved. The performance gain was noticeable. Succesful Hyper-V CI
runs using PyMI can be observed at [3][4][5][6].

Python 3. PyMI is python 3 compatible, the python 3.4 wheel is available
on pypi [7].

License. The library is Apache 2.0 licensed [8].

Packaging. Wheels for python 2.7 and 3.4 can be found on pypi. This
library is meant for Windows operating systems.

Other libraries. As mentioned before, WMI has the same functionality as
PyMI. Compared to PyMI, WMI it is unmaintained and outdated, we've hit
plenty of issues and bugs using it, it is slow, it does not have any
multithreading support, and it also depends on pywin32.

Replacing WMI with PyMI can lead to an enhanced experience overall.

[1] https://github.com/cloudbase/PyMI/commits/master
[2] https://pypi.python.org/pypi/WMI/
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/256611/
[4] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/256616/
[5] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/256614/
[6] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/256585/
[7] https://pypi.python.org/pypi/PyMI/1.0.0
[8] https://github.com/cloudbase/PyMI/blob/master/LICENSE

Change-Id: Ia2d059ed4550f0aaaea5d8da10a254ca67674eec

commit_message:
Futurist 0.13.0 release of the week

This change includes adjustments for ironic that will
allow for further integration in ironic (and elsewhere).

Small set of changes are:

- Reschedule failed periodic tasks after a short delay
- Fix wrong comparison in reject_when_reached

Change-Id: Icc8be8823890ea2e95aaf7d3c05e039b1b3688b2

commit_message:
Fix telemetry integration gate jobs

Since https://review.openstack.org/#/c/281779/2 have been
merged the telemetry integration job is broken.

Unfortunatly, it can't be fixed on our side, because we have to
rename SERVICE_TENANT_NAME in many devstack plugin, we can't merge thing
until all plugins have been fixed.

So this change restores SERVICE_TENANT_NAME, to be able to switch to SERVICE_PROJECT_NAME.

Related-bug: #1548634
Change-Id: I14ebf23aa63f0f153b934ad213a6209d22e73e9d

commit_message:
do not use realpath

We don't have realpath installed on all of the CI servers and it's
easier to not use it than wait for new images.

Change-Id: I2814c9951e92cf88967bee916b0ffc3d75905696
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
volume: add volume_clear options

Implement 3 new options for cinder::volume class:

* volume_clear
* volume_clear_size
* volume_clear_ionice

Those 3 options can be used to configure the method of volume wiping.

Change-Id: I7302b89da5a995e779ec349ab0c0f519c69a3a98

commit_message:
keystone: stop configuring paste_config

Thanks to https://review.openstack.org/#/c/280385 - the paste_config
parameter is now well set by default for both Red Hat & Ubuntu systems.
So no needs to set it in integration manifests.

Change-Id: I01a7d9f567e51ded68ea323e863878dce49ffc9b
Depends-On: I3987c254bdafe9fb23266da2fff2e21d1cd0cec3

commit_message:
Fix OpenSSL DeprecationWarning on Python 3

validate_key_cert(): encode explicitly data to UTF-8 to avoid a
DeprecationWarning of OpenSSL.

crypto.sign() calls text_to_bytes_and_warn() to encode Unicode to
UTF-8 but it raises a DeprecationWarning. Encode in
validate_key_cert() to avoid the warning.

Example of warning:

   glance/common/utils.py:427: DeprecationWarning: str for data
                               is no longer accepted, use bytes
     crypto.verify(cert, out, data, digest)

Change-Id: Iae63dd6f5a208a8835e025618b989153056bc604
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/50/281150/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Moved SSH credentials to config templates

SSH credentials have been split into 2 sets:
- fuel node login/password
- slave node login/password

The defaults are the same as before, however, configuration
has been moved to yaml templates. This will allow to move to
non-root login in fuel-qa/9.0

Change-Id: I43686f03f2403dc2feafbbdb09fa500fd217c16e
Blueprint: fuel-nonroot-openstack-nodes

commit_message:
Fix cinder error when CinderNfsMountOptions option is absent

When I deploy director with NFS backend for cinder,
sometimes I don't need nfs mount options.
If I choose to omit this option, or if the option
is defined to '', the deployment fails.

This patch add just a default value for this option.

commit_message:
Update requirements for fuel-tasklib.

Update version of 'networkx' package from requirements.txt,

Remove 'argparse' from requirements.txt as it's included in Python 2.7.

commit_message:
Wait for all KVM console types

The --wait option to make virt-install wait for the VM to complete the
install is necessary whenever we don't have a controlling console. That
is not only the case for installations started with the "-g headless"
option, but also for the other methods if the console viewer cannot be
opened, for instance, because the DISPLAY variable is not set. Without
the option, the VM does not get rebooted and must be manually started
for the installation process to continue.

This patch adds the --wait option for all KVM console types.

Change-Id: I13a40ec31e4d90afb83ba766ec8f66a0e01e63a5

commit_message:
Prevent snapshot name collisions

Skip snapshot taking if a snapshot with the given name already exists.

This is mostly useful when rebuilding (the remainder of) a cluster from
a snapshot. We do not want another series of snapshots for every test
run.

To that end, call the new vm_conditional_snapshot from generic code and
use new functions (vm_snapshot_list, vm_snapshot_exists) in back end
specific libraries to do the work.

Change-Id: If1de62bdf4272e3c9e1a198a104b1c2096ac01f7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/training-labs refs/changes/48/277548/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: function vm_snapshot_list { local vm_name=$1 # Hide VBM error on stderr if no snapshots exist $VBM snapshot "$vm_name" list --machinereadable 2>/dev/null } function vm_snapshot_exists { local vm_name=$1 local shot_name=$2 vm_snapshot_list "$vm_name" | grep -q "SnapshotName.*=\"$shot_name\"" }

commit_message:
Adds a TOTP authentication method

This method allows consumers of keystoneauth to use a time-based one
time password generator. Of course, keystone must be configured to allow
it too.

bp totp-auth

Change-Id: Ibcbae148edfcc11424893910b7c5e627beb2af24

commit_message:
Fix wrong redirect urls and template name

* change redirect urls for Job details view and Node Group Template
  details view
* remove extra 's' in template name for Job Template
* code refactoring: change class name 'JobDetailsView' to
  'JobTemplateDetailsView'

Closes-bug: 1547862

commit_message:
Match bug targets with random suffix in milestone

After main release is ready we are adding different suffixes
to milestones in corresponding series (Launchpad). For
example in 8.0.x we have these milestones now:

 * 8.0
 * 8.0-updates
 * 8.0-mu-1

Since we can't predict what exact milestones will be added
for series, let's just look for bug target which contains
given Launchpad milestone from settings. This will help us
to get correct bugs statuses in TestRail bugs statistics.

Change-Id: I0ed0a9e5c0663f86c7df5ef1f77a2f6f19464467

commit_message:
Match bug targets with random suffix in milestone

After main release is ready we are adding different suffixes
to milestones in corresponding series (Launchpad). For
example in 8.0.x we have these milestones now:

 * 8.0
 * 8.0-updates
 * 8.0-mu-1

Since we can't predict what exact milestones will be added
for series, let's just look for bug target which contains
given Launchpad milestone from settings. This will help us
to get correct bugs statuses in TestRail bugs statistics.

Change-Id: I0ed0a9e5c0663f86c7df5ef1f77a2f6f19464467

commit_message:
Fix 403 error for m-api using latest Devstack

Recent change to Devstack [1] started setting up different name for
env var that stores tenant/project name. It becomes empty in Manila
config file. Start using new name to make auth work again.

[1] I824b1121842eb5821034071874bf1bb2d7c3631e

Change-Id: Ibfa3fd402ca7b7ddaaed434609b22d9e4660b683

Fix gate that broke due to recent devstack renames

Devstack renamed TENANT->PROJECT which breaks the Barbican setup script.
See: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/281779/

commit_message:
Fix config-reference and admin-guide-cloud builds

nova-ec2 was removed from nova for mitaka, remove the file ec2-api now.
A previous change already removed nova-ec2 table.

File compute/nova-logs was renamed to compute/logs, but was referenced
by other files. Add label so that reference works.

Replace internal references to non-existing documents in
admin-guide-cloud with external links.

Note: We hit these bugs in local tests depending on python package
versions, the packages in the gate ignore the error.

Change-Id: Idece9d7186321b8b40b3020f701531908f88b6a5

commit_message:
make temporary directories stand out

Sometimes it is necessary to turn off the automatic cleanup
function. This change makes the temporary directory created stand out
more in those cases so it is easier to clean them up by hand.

Change-Id: I37e4125cb562cfeea6febd1da916e4b23726147e
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

avoid some false positives finding bug urls

The release-tools README.rst includes the documentation for the
release-notes script, including explaining the pattern we look for to
find the bug url, but without an actual URL.

commit_message:
expand the path to the repository directory

Sometimes we pass "." as the path, and that confuses the python code
trying to build the release notes, so expand the path.

Change-Id: I4a3a62c894f3c450fe8e62ed9b513d00f8536b7a
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Add new condition: is-empty

Now, if operators want to check some attribute isn't specified,
they should use 'eq' condition with None, '', etc values:

    {'op': 'eq', 'field': 'inventory.bmc_addres', 'value': ''}

It would be useful to have condition plugin witch verify this case,
'is-empty' checks that field is empty string, list, dict or None value:

    {'op': 'is-empty', 'field': 'inventory.bmc_addres'}

Change-Id: I6596a067e769530092c3db34405e0f0917d2f052

deleted_lines: #!/bin/bash # Copyright 2014 Mirantis, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. # # This script check available memory on host PC for quality provision VMs via VirtualBox # source ./config.sh source ./functions/memory.sh total_memory=$(get_available_memory) if [ $total_memory -eq -1 ]; then echo "Launch without checking RAM on host PC" echo "Auto check memory is unavailable, you need install 'free'. Please install procps package." else # Count selected RAM configuration for machine_number in $(eval echo {1..$cluster_size}); do if [ -n "${vm_slave_memory_mb[$machine_number]}" ]; then vm_total_mb=$(( $vm_total_mb + ${vm_slave_memory_mb[$machine_number]} )) else vm_total_mb=$(( $vm_total_mb + $vm_slave_memory_default )) fi done vm_total_mb=$(( $vm_total_mb + $vm_master_memory_mb )) # Do not run VMs if host PC not have enough RAM can_allocate_mb=$(( ($total_memory - 524288) / 1024 )) if [ $vm_total_mb -gt $can_allocate_mb ]; then echo "Your host has not enough memory." echo "You can allocate no more than ${can_allocate_mb}MB, but trying to run VMs with ${vm_total_mb}MB" exit 1 fi fi echo "Done."

commit_message:
Stop using WritableLogger() which is deprecated

With Eventlet 0.17.2, we can directly pass the logger instance. This
allows us to deprecate/remove the WritableLogger class from oslo.log.

Change-Id: Ic42332467c965b301af96e85b130120a283ba799
Closes-Bug: #1524860

fix vxlan example to contain a valid range

Otherwise we end up with the following error:

commit_message:
Supports IPv6 in vnc proxy.

This patch add support for IPv6 address in vnc proxy url.  It adds
brackets if an IPv6 is detected.

Change-Id: I12fb8f01b5bdca2bfea856c8a5e158fa1d87a15b
Related-Bug: 1531960
Depends-On: I093dd5a4e6294e20761cb3d33373652eeadeac36
(cherry picked from commit 9eafb7d859a2ec36d5c1cc25233ff54ccc5fdfcb)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-nova refs/changes/46/281346/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: describe 'Support IPv6' do let(:facts) { @default_facts.merge({ :osfamily => 'Debian'}) } let(:params) { { :host => '2001::1' } } it { is_expected.to contain_nova_config('vnc/novncproxy_base_url').with(:value => 'http://[2001::1]:6080/vnc_auto.html') } end

commit_message:
CentOS repo updates

* point to RDO trunk repo
* adds in delorean deps repo temporarily, until Mitaka packages are
  out of trunk.

Change-Id: I4d3547060ab2a5b75ee06e9e49655a6f938f270a

commit_message:
Add extra config yaml files for big switch agents.

This change adds extra config yaml files for big switch agent
and big switch lldp.

This change is mainly for compute nodes. The changes related
to controller nodes are landed at e78e1c8d9b5a7ebf327987b22091bff3ed42d1c1

This change also removes the neutron_enable_bigswitch_ml2 flag. Instead,
User needs to specify NeutronMechanismDrivers: bsn_ml2 in environment file.

Previous discussion about this change can be found at an abandoned
review request https://review.openstack.org/#/c/271940/

Depends-On: Iefcfe698691234490504b6747ced7bb9147118de

Change-Id: I81341a4b123dc4a8312a9a00f4b663c7cca63d7c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/22/271922/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: heat_template_version: 2015-04-30 description: Configure hieradata for Big Switch agents on compute node parameters: server: description: ID of the controller node to apply this config to type: string NeutronBigswitchAgentEnabled: description: The state of the neutron-bsn-agent service. type: boolean default: false NeutronBigswitchLLDPEnabled: description: The state of the neutron-bsn-lldp service. type: boolean default: true resources: NeutronBigswitchConfig: type: OS::Heat::StructuredConfig properties: group: os-apply-config config: hiera: datafiles: neutron_bigswitch_data: mapped_data: neutron::agents::bigswitch::agent_enabled: {get_input: neutron_enable_bigswitch_agent} neutron::agents::bigswitch::lldp_enabled: {get_input: neutron_enable_bigswitch_lldp} NeutronBigswitchDeployment: type: OS::Heat::StructuredDeployment properties: name: NeutronBigswitchDeployment config: {get_resource: NeutronBigswitchConfig} server: {get_param: server} input_values: neutron_enable_bigswitch_agent: {get_param: NeutronBigswitchAgentEnabled} neutron_enable_bigswitch_lldp: {get_param: NeutronBigswitchLLDPEnabled} outputs: deploy_stdout: description: Deployment reference, used to trigger puppet apply on changes value: {get_attr: [NeutronBigswitchDeployment, deploy_stdout]}

commit_message:
fix creation of jobs with already scheduled state

The freezer scheduler correctly creates new jobs also when
the job's status in the API is not null

Change-Id: I0af8c35eef5e98d58745c1af5e26ad0039975630
Closes-Bug: #1546269
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/freezer refs/changes/85/283185/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: logging.warning('Resetting {0} status from job {1}' .format(job.job_doc_status, job.id)) job.job_doc_status = '' if not job.event: logging.info('Autostart Job {0}'.format(job.id))
deleted_lines: logging.warning('Job {0} already has {1} status, ' 'skipping'.format(job.id, job.job_doc_status)) return None if not job.event and not job.job_doc_status: logging.warning('Autostart Job {0}'.format(job.id))

commit_message:
Add fullstack resources for linuxbridge agent

This patch adds resources, fixtures and base test_connectivity tests
for host with linuxbridge agent.

Model of host with linuxbridge agent is made in separate namespace
named "host-XXX". It has got connectivity with rabbit via ovs port.
Same port is used also to provide connectivity with different "hosts"

Co-Authored-By: Mathieu Rohon <mathieu.rohon@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I6230d8d09f77bd20674bf6c3be69fbc1627d66f8
Closes-bug: #1518675

commit_message:
Remove MapR 4.0.1 tempest test

MapR 4.0.1 is no longer supported by sahara
MapR plugin is in alpha version and is not
included by default

subject: Fix cleanup command
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-17 23:39:29.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/cmd/cleanup.py', 'tempest/cmd/cleanup_service.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/41711d3ceeb7d93b3cbe0da86830c3252e03ba21', 'message': 'Fix cleanup command

There are few issues in cleanup command which makes it
in failure state.

1. Deprecated tenant name of identity grp is being used
   - Devstack does not set these deprecated options now so it fails
     with tenant Not Found
2. Running cleanup operation for --init-saved-state option too
   - --init-saved-state option should just save the state not run actual
     cleanup. After states are saved, user should be able to verify/edit that and
     then run cleanup in normal mode.

With above issues fix, cleanup command runs successfully.

Change-Id: Ifd393d1f8d6e070e52e2a0a2d42a765cd6d4f5f5
'}]
commit_message:
Fix cleanup command

There are few issues in cleanup command which makes it
in failure state.

1. Deprecated tenant name of identity grp is being used
   - Devstack does not set these deprecated options now so it fails
     with tenant Not Found
2. Running cleanup operation for --init-saved-state option too
   - --init-saved-state option should just save the state not run actual
     cleanup. After states are saved, user should be able to verify/edit that and
     then run cleanup in normal mode.

With above issues fix, cleanup command runs successfully.

Change-Id: Ifd393d1f8d6e070e52e2a0a2d42a765cd6d4f5f5

commit_message:
Switch for Keystone DB cron job

- Adds parameter to enable switching off token flush cron job.
- Sets destination for deleted rows to /dev/null

Change-Id: I9e8aed969e81595d8a1d0a5300da17da6ba15c03
Partial-bug: rhbz#1249106

commit_message:
Fix ovs status command

Make sure the status command returns failure if either the ovsdb-server
or ovs-vswitchd are stopped.

Closes-Bug: 1453211
Change-Id: I372e3f387deb2930d10c209afa3773c7ba3877e3

commit_message:
DevStack: Add support for deploying nodes with pxe_ipmitool

This patch is adding support for deploying nodes with the pxe_ipmitool
driver and VMs.

The patch adds a dependency on the "virtualbmc" utility which is
responsible for creating a virtual/fake BMC that handles the IPMI
commands (using pyghmi.bmc) and convert it to calls to the
python-libvirt library.

The function "is_ironic_hardware" was converted into a variable called
"IRONIC_IS_HARDWARE" which can be set to True/False to indicate whether
DevStack is being setup for baremetal or VMs.

Partial-Bug: #1544642
Change-Id: I5edc51c7fc8b6f0bb7fe4ca129596709a32eb93e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/67/280267/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: VBMC_PORT=$8 LOGDIR=$9 # Createa Virtual BMC for the nodes if IPMI is used if [[ -z "${IRONIC_DEPLOY_DRIVER##*_ipmitool}" ]]; then sudo vbmc add $NAME --port $VBMC_PORT sudo vbmc start $NAME fiVM_MAC=$(virsh dumpxml $NAME | grep "mac address" | head -1 | cut -d\' -f2) echo $VM_MAC $VBMC_PORT
deleted_lines: LOGDIR=$8virsh dumpxml $NAME | grep "mac address" | head -1 | cut -d\' -f2

commit_message:
Enable Dell Storage Center iscsi Backends in Cinder

Enables support for configuring Cinder with a Dell
Storage Center iscsi storage backend.
This change adds all relevant parameters for:
 - Dell Storage Center SC Series (iSCSI)

Change-Id: I3b1a4346f494139ab123c7dc1a62f81d03c9e728
(cherry picked from commit 1905a6247c4004451312f58656beea70137c5b4b)

commit_message:
documented nagios configuration

Change-Id: I54369730fd22213d0041a93725df3982a5299979
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/vitrage refs/changes/81/283481/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: =========================== Nagios Plugin Configuration =========================== Configure Access to Nagios -------------------------- The following should be set in **/etc/vitrage/vitrage.conf**, under synchronizer_plugins section: +----------------------+------------------------------------+--------------------------------+ | Name | Description | Default Value | +======================+====================================+================================+ | nagios_user | Nagios user | | +----------------------+------------------------------------+--------------------------------+ | nagios_password | Nagios password | | +----------------------+------------------------------------+--------------------------------+ | nagios_url | Nagios url for querying the data | | +----------------------+------------------------------------+--------------------------------+ | nagios_config_file | Nagios configuration file | /etc/vitrage/nagios_conf.yaml | +----------------------+------------------------------------+--------------------------------+ **Example** nagios_user = nagios nagios_password = nagios nagios_url = http://10.20.30.40/monitoring/nagios/cgi-bin/status.cgi nagios_config_file = /etc/vitrage/nagios_conf.yaml Configure Nagios Host Mapping ----------------------------- Nagios tests are defined in a table with columns: Host, Service, Status, Last Check, etc. Nagios "Host" is not necessarily a resource of type host. It can also be an instance, switch, or other resource types. **nagios_conf.yaml** is used to map Nagios host type to a Vitrage resource. **Format** :: nagios: - nagios_host: <Host as appears in Nagios> type: <resource type in Vitrage> name: <resource name in Vitrage> - nagios_host: <Host as appears in Nagios> type: <resource type in Vitrage> name: <resource name in Vitrage> ... **Example** The following file will map compute-1 to a nova.host named compute-1; and compute-2 to a nova.host named host2 :: nagios: - nagios_host: compute-1 type: nova.host name: compute-1 - nagios_host: compute-2 type: nova.host name: host2 **Default Configuration** A default nagios_conf.yaml will be installed with Vitrage. Its content is still TBD, but it will be similar to the following example. All Nagios hosts named host* or * -devstack will be mapped in Vitrage to resoruces of type nova.host with the same name; and all Nagios hosts named instance* will be mapped to nova.instance resources. :: nagios: - nagios_host: host-(.*) type: nova.host name: ${nagios_host} - nagios_host: (.*)-devstack type: nova.host name: ${nagios_host} - nagios_host: instance-(.*) type: nova.instance name: ${nagios_host}

commit_message:
Add remotefx related utils

This patch adds utils methods for creating VMs with a
RemoteFX video adapter.

Implements: blueprint hyper-v-remotefx

Change-Id: I1ebcefa848190f173cac259935ced987676aa916
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-win refs/changes/53/263553/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from os_win import exceptionsfrom os_win.utils import constants def test_vm_gen_supports_remotefx(self): ret = self._vmutils.vm_gen_supports_remotefx(mock.sentinel.VM_GEN) self.assertTrue(ret) def test_validate_remotefx_monitor_count(self): self.assertRaises(exceptions.HyperVException, self._vmutils._validate_remotefx_params, 10, constants.REMOTEFX_MAX_RES_1024x768 ) def test_validate_remotefx_max_resolution(self): self.assertRaises(exceptions.HyperVException, self._vmutils._validate_remotefx_params, 1, '1024x700') def test_validate_remotefx_vram(self): self.assertRaises(exceptions.HyperVException, self._vmutils._validate_remotefx_params, 1, constants.REMOTEFX_MAX_RES_1024x768, vram_bytes=10000)

commit_message:
Remove check-deletions from openstack-manuals

The check-deletions job is obsolete on this repository, remove it.
The repository is mainly RST (with one exception) and thus this XML
specific check is not needed.

It's part of the template openstack-doc-gate, so use openstack-rst-gate
instead and add those jobs that are not in the rst-gate.

Change-Id: I601ee6308c46a2ab322b2ae6160ebc4692b2634f

commit_message:
config options: Centralise 'virt.disk' options

Add options from 'virt.disk'. These options are part of the
'DEFAULT' group but are included in the "nova.conf.virt" file in hope
that they can eventually be moved to their own group.

Change-Id: Ie69f5bef5f65c7ffe42adeff1defc8e86649bdba
Implements: bp centralize-config-options
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/12/258912/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(yamahata): ListOpt won't work because the command may include a comma. # For example: # # mkfs.ext4 -O dir_index,extent -E stride=8,stripe-width=16 # --label %(fs_label)s %(target)s # # list arguments are comma separated and there is no way to escape such # commas. virt_mkfs = cfg.MultiStrOpt( 'virt_mkfs', default=[], help='Name of the mkfs commands for ephemeral device. ' 'The format is <os_type>=<mkfs command>') resize_fs_using_block_device = cfg.BoolOpt( 'resize_fs_using_block_device', default=False, help='Attempt to resize the filesystem by accessing the ' 'image over a block device. This is done by the host ' 'and may not be necessary if the image contains a recent ' 'version of cloud-init. Possible mechanisms require ' 'the nbd driver (for qcow and raw), or loop (for raw).') timeout_nbd = cfg.IntOpt( 'timeout_nbd', default=10, help='Amount of time, in seconds, to wait for NBD ' 'device start up.') injected_network_template, virt_mkfs, resize_fs_using_block_device, timeout_nbd]

commit_message:
Fix property TTL in Designate::Domain

Current property ttl of Domain is incorrect:
1. Minimum of ttl is 1, not 0;
2. If ttl is None, it should not be in create method args.

Change-Id: I632c13f879bd42cf829bc3b490850e78f371ff0f
Closes-bug: #1523538
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/56/254256/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Based on RFC 1035, range for ttl is set to 1 to signed 32 bit number constraints=[constraints.Range(min=1, description=self.properties[self.DESCRIPTION] ttl = self.properties[self.TTL] if ttl is not None and ttl > 0: args.update({self.TTL: self.properties[self.TTL]})
deleted_lines: # Based on RFC 1035, range for ttl is set to 0 to signed 32 bit number constraints=[constraints.Range(min=0, description=self.properties[self.DESCRIPTION], ttl=self.properties[self.TTL]

commit_message:
Add is_ipv6_address function

This functions returns true if the string passed is a valid IPv6
address, otherwise false.

Change-Id: I40b327eb39f12035c8f86c5724c3e005345d0449
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo refs/changes/60/271260/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # # is_ipv6_address.rb # module Puppet::Parser::Functions newfunction(:is_ipv6_address, :type => :rvalue, :doc => ("Returns true if the string passed to this function" + "is a valid IP address.")) do |arguments| require 'ipaddr' if (arguments.size != 1) then raise(Puppet::ParseError, "is_ipv6_address(): Wrong number of arguments "+ "given #{arguments.size} for 1") end begin ip = IPAddr.new(arguments[0]) rescue ArgumentError return false end if ip.ipv6? then return true else return false end end end # vim: set ts=2 sw=2 et :

commit_message:
config options: Centralise 'virt.netutils' options

Add options from 'virt.netutils'. These options are part of the
'DEFAULT' group but are included in the "nova.conf.virt" file in hope
that they can eventually be moved to their own group.

Change-Id: Iadde1aff056008988d21deb914cdd18c8347e5d3
Implements: bp centralize-config-options
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/09/258009/26 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from nova import paths injected_network_template = cfg.StrOpt( 'injected_network_template', default=paths.basedir_def('nova/virt/interfaces.template'), help='Template file for injected network') force_raw_images, injected_network_template]

commit_message:
Improve 'virt.firewall' conf options documentation

Change-Id: I3a023ecd990762f3a602d71cd7c39d8b4fac5829
Related-Bug: #1360260
Implements: bp centralize-config-options
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/65/266365/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: help="""Firewall driver to use with ``nova-network`` service. Determine which firewall the legacy networking service, ``nova-network``, should use. This option only applies when using the ``nova-network`` service. When using another networking services, such as Neutron, this should be to set to the ``NoopFirewallDriver``. The option defaults to hypervisor-specific ``iptables`` driver. Possible values: * nova.virt.firewall.IptablesFirewallDriver * nova.virt.firewall.NoopFirewallDriver * ... Services which consume this: * nova-network Interdependencies to other options: * None """) help="""Determine whether to allow network traffic from same network. This option only applies when using the ``nova-network`` service. When using another networking services, such as Neutron, security groups or other approaches should be used. Possible values: * True: Network traffic should be allowed pass between instances * False: Network traffic should not be allowed pass between instances Services which consume this: * nova-network Interdependencies to other options: * None """)
deleted_lines: help='Firewall driver ' '(defaults to hypervisor specific iptables driver)') help='Whether to allow network traffic from same network')

commit_message:
dry out container unittests

Change Ifcc4392ffa4df485ce3c62a35d0fcc8c93de74aa introduced
TestContainerController4Replicas as a subclass of
TestContainerController. And there is duplicated code
block to override setUp method.

This patch removed the duplicated code block.

Change-Id: Iad0b64cba52554b89dbd959475a2ce7c0d9a20eb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/73/282173/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: CONTAINER_REPLICAS = 3 self.container_ring = FakeRing(replicas=self.CONTAINER_REPLICAS, max_more_nodes=9) CONTAINER_REPLICAS = 4
deleted_lines: self.container_ring = FakeRing(max_more_nodes=9) def setUp(self): TestRingBase.setUp(self) self.logger = debug_logger() self.container_ring = FakeRing(replicas=4, max_more_nodes=9) self.app = proxy_server.Application(None, FakeMemcache(), logger=self.logger, account_ring=FakeRing(replicas=4), container_ring=self.container_ring) self.account_info = { 'status': 200, 'container_count': '10', 'total_object_count': '100', 'bytes': '1000', 'meta': {}, 'sysmeta': {}, } class FakeAccountInfoContainerController( proxy_server.ContainerController): def account_info(controller, *args, **kwargs): patch_path = 'swift.proxy.controllers.base.get_info' with mock.patch(patch_path) as mock_get_info: mock_get_info.return_value = dict(self.account_info) return super(FakeAccountInfoContainerController, controller).account_info( *args, **kwargs) _orig_get_controller = self.app.get_controller def wrapped_get_controller(*args, **kwargs): with mock.patch('swift.proxy.server.ContainerController', new=FakeAccountInfoContainerController): return _orig_get_controller(*args, **kwargs) self.app.get_controller = wrapped_get_controller

commit_message:
config options: Centralise 'virt.firewall' options

Add options from 'virt.firewall'. These options are part of the
'DEFAULT' group but are included in the "nova.conf.virt" file in hope
that they can eventually be moved to their own group.

Change-Id: I54d7bbe416d908edf3447b36e054be189f9d5bf9
Implements: bp centralize-config-options

added_lines: """) help="""Defines which driver to use for controlling virtualization. Possible values: * libvirt.LibvirtDriver * xenapi.XenAPIDriver * fake.FakeDriver * ironic.IronicDriver * vmwareapi.VMwareVCDriver * hyperv.HyperVDriver * ... Services which consume this: * nova-scheduler * nova-compute """) help="""The default format an ephemeral_volume will be formatted with on creation. Possible values: * ext2 * ext3 * ext4 * ufs * iso9660 * ... Services which consume this: * nova-compute """) help="""The image preallocation mode to use. Image preallocation allows storage for instance images to be allocated up front when the instance is initially provisioned. This ensures immediate feedback is given if enough space isn't available. In addition, it should significantly improve performance on writes to new blocks and may even improve I/O performance to prewritten blocks due to reduced fragmentation. Possible values: * "none" => no storage provisioning is done up front * "space" => storage is fully allocated at instance start Services which consume this: * nova-compute """) help="""Enable use of cow images. Services which consume this: * nova-compute """) help="""Determine if instance should boot should fail if VIF plugging fails. Nova sends a port update to Neutron after an instance has been scheduled, providing Neutron with the necessary information to finish setup of the port. Once completed, Neutron notifies Nova that it has finished setting up the port, at which point Nova resumes the boot of the VM since network connectivity is now supposed to be present. A timeout will occur if the reply is not received after a given interval, and this option determines what Nova does when that happens. When enabled, the instance will error out. When disabled, the instance will continue to boot on the assumption that the port is ready. Services which consume this: * nova-scheduler """) help="""Number of seconds to wait for Neutron vif plugging events to arrive before continuing or failing (see 'vif_plugging_is_fatal'). If this is set to zero and 'vif_plugging_is_fatal' is False, events should not be expected to arrive at all. Services which consume this: * nova-scheduler """)
deleted_lines: Related options: * None""") help='Driver to use for controlling virtualization. Options ' 'include: libvirt.LibvirtDriver, xenapi.XenAPIDriver, ' 'fake.FakeDriver, ironic.IronicDriver, ' 'vmwareapi.VMwareVCDriver, hyperv.HyperVDriver') help='The default format an ephemeral_volume will be ' 'formatted with on creation.') help='VM image preallocation mode: ' '"none" => no storage provisioning is done up front, ' '"space" => storage is fully allocated at instance start') help='Whether to use cow images') help='Fail instance boot if vif plugging fails') help='Number of seconds to wait for neutron vif plugging ' 'events to arrive before continuing or failing (see ' 'vif_plugging_is_fatal). If this is set to zero and ' 'vif_plugging_is_fatal is False, events should not ' 'be expected to arrive at all.')

commit_message:
docs: Update README.md to point to new Beaker URL

The URL [1] to the docs for writing Beaker tests (specifically beaker-rspec)
have moved. The README.md still points to the old URL. This commit fixes
this by pointing to a better URL [2].

[1] https://github.com/puppetlabs/beaker/wiki/How-to-Write-a-Beaker-Test-for-a-Module

[2] https://github.com/puppetlabs/beaker-rspec/blob/master/README.md

Change-Id: I5ab2f0b04c07411b0b2af17b77f49a5be18dc5ba
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-magnum refs/changes/90/276590/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

Clean up validator lists

Move signature validation to standards validators. Remove old validator entries
from the setup.cfg.

added_lines: import mockfrom pyasn1_modules import rfc2459 class TestCsrSignature(tests.DefaultRequestMixin, unittest.TestCase): def test_csr_signature(self): csr = signing_request.X509Csr.from_buffer(self.csr_sample_bytes) self.assertIsNone(standards._csr_signature(csr=csr)) def test_csr_signature_bad_sig(self): csr = signing_request.X509Csr.from_buffer(self.csr_sample_bytes) with mock.patch.object(signing_request.X509Csr, '_get_signature', return_value=(b'A'*49)): with self.assertRaisesRegexp(errors.ValidationError, "Signature on the CSR is not valid"): standards._csr_signature(csr=csr) def test_csr_signature_bad_algo(self): csr = signing_request.X509Csr.from_buffer(self.csr_sample_bytes) with mock.patch.object(signing_request.X509Csr, '_get_signing_algorithm', return_value=rfc2459.id_dsa_with_sha1): with self.assertRaisesRegexp(errors.ValidationError, "Signature on the CSR is not valid"): standards._csr_signature(csr=csr)

commit_message:
Don't fail on unknown name elements

Names cannot be parsed if the type is unknown. Just return the string "UNKNOWN"
as a value in that case.

Change-Id: I12889b139907e0bd852ad842ad5b7d027adb0949
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/anchor refs/changes/04/274504/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: oid = self.get_oid() if oid not in name_oids: return 'UNKNOWN' name_spec = name_oids[oid]()

subject: Add removing of staled VIPs to AllocateVIPs70Mixin
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-15 13:39:11.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web/commit/49e48bc9ec3801cae92390f1b203d466a0d2bb7c', 'message': 'Add removing of staled VIPs to AllocateVIPs70Mixin

This patch adds fix for following issue: when VIP mapping had changed
for network roles of cluster, already assigned VIP entries may not have been
purged on the next allocation. As a particular example: VIP
information completely moved from one network role to another that was
bound to different network group than former.

Change-Id: I269afc4137c7cb69603d4b5fac0e5c4bb905f3a0
Implements: allow-any-vip
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-02-15 13:40:01.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web/commit/ef3be21ecdda612604e2ed57574056b421bf3332', 'message': 'Add removing of staled VIPs to AllocateVIPs70Mixin

This patch adds fix for following issue: when VIP mapping had changed
for network roles of cluster, already assigned VIP entries may not have been
purged on the next allocation. As a particular example: VIP
information completely moved from one network role to another that was
bound to different network group than former.

commit_message:
Add removing of staled VIPs to AllocateVIPs70Mixin

This patch adds fix for following issue: when VIP mapping had changed
for network roles of cluster, already assigned VIP entries may not have been
purged on the next allocation. As a particular example: VIP
information completely moved from one network role to another that was
bound to different network group than former.

Change-Id: I269afc4137c7cb69603d4b5fac0e5c4bb905f3a0
Blueprint: allow-any-vip
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web refs/changes/26/280226/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _get_vip_to_preserve(csl, vips_db, nodegroup, net_group_name, vip_name): for ip in vips_db: if all([ip.vip_name == vip_name, ip.network_data.nodegroup.id == nodegroup.id, ip.network_data.name == net_group_name]): return ip @classmethod def purge_stalled_vips(cls, cluster, net_role_vip_mappings): vips_to_purge = cls._get_assigned_vips_for_net_groups(cluster).all() # if there is no assigned VIPs, do nothing if vips_to_purge: for vip_mapping in net_role_vip_mappings: nodegroup, net_group_name, vip_name = vip_mapping[:3] vip_to_preserve = cls._get_vip_to_preserve( vips_to_purge, nodegroup, net_group_name, vip_name ) if vip_to_preserve: vips_to_purge.remove(vip_to_preserve) # vips to purge is modified inside the loop above # and may not contain elements at this point if vips_to_purge: db.query(IPAddr).filter( IPAddr.id.in_([ip.id for ip in vips_to_purge]) ).delete(synchronize_session='fetch') @classmethod def _assign_vips_for_net_groups(cls, cluster): net_role_vip_mappings = cls.get_node_groups_info(cluster) cls.purge_stalled_vips(cluster, net_role_vip_mappings) in net_role_vip_mappings: # final result of the method net_role_vip_mappings = [] net_role_vip_mappings.append( [nodegroup, net_group, vip_name, role, vip_info] ) return net_role_vip_mappings
deleted_lines: def _assign_vips_for_net_groups(cls, cluster): in cls.get_node_groups_info(cluster): yield nodegroup, net_group, vip_name, role, vip_info

Highlight mutable options in the sample config generator and in the
sphinx integration.

commit_message:
Fix a spelling typo in config's help

for
puppet-neutron/templates/n1kv.conf.erb

Plus a little fix for source comment:
paramter -> parameter
for lib/puppet/provider/nova_admin_tenant_id_setter/ini_setting.rb

commit_message:
Remove unneeded deps

Percona has fixed their packaging issue and now
MySQL-python installs cleanly without the need of MariaDB-shared
package.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I42672c269185352ab4999683bd0ad7c5f23de3bb

commit_message:
Add functionality from NetworkManager to objects

In preparation of removing direct database queries from NetworkManager,
methods which are functionally equivalent have been added to the appropriate
objects.

Change-Id: Ic6d4984e4eb10e6cb897a929eee7a47e67798451
Blueprint: network-config-refactoring

commit_message:
Convert count to int in cluster scale_out/in action

When using receiver to triger an scale_out/in action with count
as inputs, it will not convert count to int. This patch fixes it.

Change-Id: I67bf8ede5b3702d1db22775e51274722f9d29418
Closes-Bug: #1548234
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/senlin refs/changes/16/283016/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_do_scale_out_count_invalid(self, mock_load): cluster = mock.Mock() cluster.ACTIVE = 'ACTIVE' cluster.RESIZING = 'RESIZING' cluster.id = 'CID' mock_load.return_value = cluster action = ca.ClusterAction(cluster.id, 'CLUSTER_ACTION', self.ctx) action.data = {} action.inputs = {'count': 'tt'} # do it res_code, res_msg = action.do_scale_out() # assertions self.assertEqual(action.RES_ERROR, res_code) reason = 'Invalid count (tt) for scaling out.' self.assertEqual(reason, res_msg) cluster.set_status.assert_has_calls([ mock.call(action.context, 'RESIZING', 'Cluster scale out started.'), mock.call(action.context, 'ACTIVE', 'Cluster scaling failed: %s' % reason)]) def test_do_scale_in_negative_count(self, mock_load): def test_do_scale_in_invalid_count(self, mock_load): cluster = mock.Mock() cluster.ACTIVE = 'ACTIVE' cluster.RESIZING = 'RESIZING' cluster.id = 'CID' cluster.min_size = 1 cluster.max_size = -1 cluster.nodes = [] for i in range(5): node = mock.Mock() node.id = 'NODE_ID_%s' % (i + 1) cluster.nodes.append(node) mock_load.return_value = cluster action = ca.ClusterAction(cluster.id, 'CLUSTER_ACTION', self.ctx) action.data = {} action.inputs = {'count': 'tt'} # do it res_code, res_msg = action.do_scale_in() # assertions reason = 'Invalid count (tt) for scaling in.' self.assertEqual(reason, res_msg) self.assertEqual(action.RES_ERROR, res_code) cluster.set_status.assert_has_calls([ mock.call(action.context, 'RESIZING', 'Cluster scale in started.'), mock.call(action.context, 'ACTIVE', 'Cluster scaling failed: %s' % reason)])

commit_message:
Refactor the signing backends

Prepare for new signing backend implementations which reuse the existing
functionality. This abstracts most of the current signing function, so that the
signature generation itself can be replaced.

Change-Id: I99a28f4bcb08f010f397faf49e23276672977bc1

commit_message:
Make copy of the name

Don't return a name which points back to the certificate internals anymore. Use
copies of the name everywhere.

shuffle.  This change restores the special handling.

subject: Add sahara_dashboard to ADD_INSTALLED_APPS for translation support
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-21 17:20:33.000000000', 'files': ['sahara_dashboard/enabled/_1810_data_processing_panel_group.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/sahara-dashboard/commit/c08ed62be3e652e75c9f66fa7c0224c0691c66ad', 'message': "Add sahara_dashboard to ADD_INSTALLED_APPS for translation support

The infra script assumes that transaltion files is placed under
sahara_dashboard/locale and it is required that 'sahara_dashboard'
is included in ADD_INSTALLED_APPS to make translation work.

It did not work to add symlink to 'sahara_dashboard/locale'
and it was reverted by commit 55512fcc5e8d2db09896bcc55352912f8e650b08.
This commit explores another way to support translation.

Note that other entries in ADD_INSTALLED_APPS are not touched

Change-Id: I214fca300df771ff3f35e8a9efe216104f48ebd4

commit_message:
Add sahara_dashboard to ADD_INSTALLED_APPS for translation support

The infra script assumes that transaltion files is placed under
sahara_dashboard/locale and it is required that 'sahara_dashboard'
is included in ADD_INSTALLED_APPS to make translation work.

It did not work to add symlink to 'sahara_dashboard/locale'
and it was reverted by commit 55512fcc5e8d2db09896bcc55352912f8e650b08.
This commit explores another way to support translation.

Note that other entries in ADD_INSTALLED_APPS are not touched
to avoid breaking other stuff of sahara-dashboard.
I don't know the background of using the current ADD_INSTALLED_APPS,
so cleaning them up is out of scope of this patch.

Change-Id: I214fca300df771ff3f35e8a9efe216104f48ebd4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sahara-dashboard refs/changes/83/282883/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ADD_INSTALLED_APPS = ['sahara_dashboard']

commit_message:
Only update apt cache if necessary

Workarounding the upstream ansible apt module bug

documented here:

https://github.com/ansible/ansible-modules-core/pull/1517

For the next versions of ansible we'll be using, we should

check if the apt bug is fixed. When it's fixed, we could

abandon this change and use the standard apt module

with correct cache handling.

Change-Id: I4390b7ec1104d79b60965be8dc7317ac3075207d

commit_message:
Add fbp_copy_plugin to avoid attr error

We do not have docker containers on master node anymore,
but at the same time want to assert plugin
installation from directory that differs from build one.
So add copy method into FuelPluginBuilder()

Aslo add self.show_step() invocation

Closes-Bug: #1548348

Change-Id: I155845f86c4beaaa2fbd45c8273f163d6d8eb2c7

commit_message:
Remove bandit.yaml in favor of default config

Latest g-r version of bandit does not require a bandit.yaml any
longer. This removes the bandit.yaml and the anchor gate profile
(which was not part of a gate job).

Change-Id: I1f6f9b8590f44e15662ea2f4212fbd68c072e422

commit_message:
nova: specify glance url proto

If we don't specify the proto, nova-api sends a nice warning about that:

No protocol specified in for api_server 'http://localhost:9292'please
update [glance] api_servers with fully qualified url including
scheme (http / https).

Change-Id: Iee5c3a7312954259d75c1125c07ac79bd9bbb1b4

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-18 14:01:49.000000000', 'files': ['os_win/utils/network/networkutils.py', 'os_win/tests/utils/network/test_networkutils.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/os-win/commit/c9b8284df3029d400a977d7cc9def4c0565cede7', 'message': 'Create a new object instead of querying the default one

commit_message:
Create a new object instead of querying the default one

Currently, a WMI Setting Data (Port VLAN, Port Security) is created
by querying the default object. Under large scale environments,
this can lead to huge execution times, as the query takes longer to
complete. This can lead to late port binding and missed DHCP
requests, leaving the VM with no IP.

A solution for this is to create the needed object (.new()) instead
of querying the default one.

(cherry picked from commit 9f6241e0a63a2bd36392eeb3c997786d53119a39)

Change-Id: Ib492afe5387373a40d964e76fa6b4b0ee3b5666d
Partial-Bug: #1505196

revisions:

commit_message:
Avoid wmi query while creating an acl

Wmi query is run everytime when a empty acl object is created.
This causes the time incurred to create and apply firewall rules
proportional to already existing ACLs in the WMI table.
Avoiding the query makes creation of ACL a constant function.

Fixes Bug: #1503630

Co-Authored-By: krishna kanth <krishna.kanth-mallela@hp.com>

(cherry picked from commit 7dc70ea31e8c9b3875d56a49a16de1a2871292ab)

Change-Id: I68a2d2590d7a17fa572662bf8ba25d84fc5a0d98

commit_message:
Refactors disconnect_switch_port

Removes argument which was always sent with the same value.
If the switch port was already destroyed by Hyper-V, ignore
the raised x_wmi exception.

Renames the method to remove_switch_port.

Closes-Bug: #1536736

(cherry picked from commit f1d0c4d4e6f8c9cd426bb0e117fd7411a543c16d)

Change-Id: I277732f17ff42f3bb7cb2923e13c2036f96cf2d9

commit_message:
Adds vNIC event listeners

Instead of querying vNICs periodically, listeners can
be subscribed to their creation and deletion events.
Thus, querying the vNICs won't be necessary, which can be
an expensive operation under large scale operations.

(cherry picked from commit c3191cf433dda1386bd55e4fa37adb764fb0b1a0)

Partially-Implements: blueprint scale-hyperv-neutron-agent

Change-Id: Ieca62a25372ddd299db1ff5750d5e1cc745af9ed
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-win refs/changes/74/281874/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @mock.patch.object(networkutils, 'wmi', create=True) @mock.patch.object(networkutils.NetworkUtils, '_get_event_wql_query') def test_get_vnic_event_listener(self, mock_get_event_query, mock_wmi): mock_wmi.x_wmi_timed_out = ValueError event = mock.MagicMock() port_class = self.netutils._conn.Msvm_SyntheticEthernetPortSettingData wmi_event_listener = port_class.watch_for.return_value wmi_event_listener.side_effect = [mock_wmi.x_wmi_timed_out, event] # callback will raise an exception in order to stop iteration in the # listener. callback = mock.MagicMock(side_effect=TypeError) returned_listener = self.netutils.get_vnic_event_listener( self.netutils.EVENT_TYPE_CREATE) self.assertRaises(TypeError, returned_listener, callback) mock_get_event_query.assert_called_once_with( cls=self.netutils._VNIC_SET_DATA, event_type=self.netutils.EVENT_TYPE_CREATE, timeframe=2) port_class.watch_for.assert_called_once_with( mock_get_event_query.return_value) wmi_event_listener.assert_has_calls( [mock.call(self.netutils._VNIC_LISTENER_TIMEOUT_MS)] * 2) callback.assert_called_once_with(event.ElementName) def test_get_event_wql_query(self): expected = ("SELECT * FROM %(event_type)s WITHIN %(timeframe)s " "WHERE TargetInstance ISA '%(class)s' AND " "%(like)s" % { 'class': "FakeClass", 'event_type': self.netutils.EVENT_TYPE_CREATE, 'like': "TargetInstance.foo LIKE 'bar%'", 'timeframe': 2}) query = self.netutils._get_event_wql_query( "FakeClass", self.netutils.EVENT_TYPE_CREATE, like=dict(foo="bar")) self.assertEqual(expected, query)

commit_message:
Clean the KOLLA_CONFIG_STRATEGY setting

I found this while doing code review, and think this can be cleaned
up. KOLLA_CONFIG_STRATEGY is defined in docker_common_options, so
there is no reason and not necessary to specify this at per service
base.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I90a137ceaa8f6175ce9525f5601761470ba65621

revisions:

This fix agent generator to have the generated files passing lint test.

Change-Id: I246eee81de6e8148f4f8c01e6deb42b20775079a
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-02-17 17:46:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-pacemaker/commit/acba31ba9655c3ff1e78eb9ea11c0c984b760858', 'message': 'Fix codebase for lint compliance.

This fixes agent generator to have the generated files passing lint test.
It also adds a rake task.

The stonith/ files were generated using it.  fence_xvm is documented to
be updated manually in the variable.sh file.  It will need to be
investigated, and if possible refactored to be able to work with the generator

commit_message:
Fixes for lint compliance and working specs.

This fixes agent generator to have the generated files passing lint
test.  It also adds a rake task.

The stonith/ files were generated using it.  fence_xvm is documented to
be updated manually in the variable.sh file.  It will need to be
investigated, and if possible refactored to be able to work with the
generator for simpler updates.

Co-Authored-By: Jason Guiditta <jguiditt@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I246eee81de6e8148f4f8c01e6deb42b20775079a

commit_message:
Add check for bad parameter in policy-list

Adding check for the wrong parameters in the command for listing
the policies i.e., policy-list.

If the wrong parameter is passed with this command than it will
raise the HTTPBadRequest exception with an error message 'Invalid
parameter <param_name>'

Change-Id: I45a20eb57ff753d83ae8a9710f7ff1ac7efa215e
Closes-Bug: #1548435
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/senlin refs/changes/04/283204/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: for key in req.params.keys(): if (key not in param_whitelist.keys() and key not in filter_whitelist.keys()): raise exc.HTTPBadRequest(_('Invalid parameter %s') % key)

subject: Reduce number of OS combinations for tests
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-22 20:19:40.000000000', 'files': ['lib/puppet-openstack_spec_helper/defaults.rb'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-openstack_spec_helper/commit/e844c0797de96eac0c360d65ef969307d8ff3990', 'message': 'Reduce number of OS combinations for tests

This change reduces the amount of different operating system
combinations that we will use for our unit tests. Previously we were
running tests on both CentOS 7 and RedHat 7 which are pretty much
identical for our modules. Additionally we were testing two versions
of Fedora (21 and 22) and two versions of Debian (7 and 8).

This change leaves the following OS combinations for unit tests:
- CentOS 7
- Fedora 22
- Ubuntu 14.04
- Debian 8

If a change adds any specific operating system requirements, like
actually looking for RedHat specifically, the test should be updated
with a specific case for RedHat rather than globally testing for
RedHat.

Change-Id: Ib9be991897e8707342f984caccb3f75aa26742e2
'}]
commit_message:
Reduce number of OS combinations for tests

This change reduces the amount of different operating system
combinations that we will use for our unit tests. Previously we were
running tests on both CentOS 7 and RedHat 7 which are pretty much
identical for our modules. Additionally we were testing two versions
of Fedora (21 and 22) and two versions of Debian (7 and 8).

This change leaves the following OS combinations for unit tests:
- CentOS 7
- Fedora 22
- Ubuntu 14.04
- Debian 8

If a change adds any specific operating system requirements, like
actually looking for RedHat specifically, the test should be updated
with a specific case for RedHat rather than globally testing for
RedHat.

Change-Id: Ib9be991897e8707342f984caccb3f75aa26742e2

commit_message:
Fix table _get_rows() - always return None

This function wasn't really used yet, so it actually doesn't break
anything. It does computation but there is missing 'return' statement.


Closes-Bug: 1479832
Partially implements blueprint: selenium-integration-testing
Change-Id: Iadfd349dcaf0f319f5832eedc5fdae02f892c47f

containers on master node anymore,

commit_message:
Use instanceof instead of type

Adjusted conditional statements to use instanceof when
comparing variables. Instanceof supports inheritance type
checking better than type.

Change-Id: I4ee0004934dc2322d43ef07e797a6811e39a812c
Closes-Bug: 1548530

commit_message:
Terminate volumes connections on shelve_offload

In shelve_offload, a VM loses it's connection to a host.
It's volumes also shouldn't be attached to a host, so terminate
their connection to the host

Change-Id: I60edc9b4715f275dfca8299bcb6eeec10157950d
Closes-Bug: #1547142

commit_message:
Fix Swift logging

Swift uses Syslog, but it uses a custom log format.  So this commit
adds a specific Heka decoder for Swift.

It also increases the log level from "warning" to "info" to make
Swift more verbose.  Note that "info" is the default log level in
Swift.

And it disables the Heka configuration for Swift when "enable_swift"
is set to "no".  This prevents Heka from creating 15 empty Swift log
files in the logs volume.

Partially implements: blueprint heka

Change-Id: If7a7d0707e71be2957178e2d45b5de51b788232e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/18/283118/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: log_level = INFO
